intro: Heliotropium sokotranum, commonly known as the Socotra heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptation to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its unique appearance and limited distribution make it a notable species in botanical studies.
